instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V35_S3: What is PP1V35_S3? PP1V35_S3 is a 1.35v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - Dead pp5vS4/0
threads.message:
Hi,

I am new to this i need some help


First question PP5vS4 has a resitance to ground of  18 ohms when i plug in the power, when unplugged it keep dropping from server 100s Kohms

these are my voltages,

[QUOTE]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> [B]12.6v[/B]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> [B]12v6[/B]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V</SIGNAL> [B]12v6[/B]
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3</SIGNAL> [B]12v6[/B]

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_IOSL</SIGNAL> [B]16v6[/B]
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> [B]16v6[/B]

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>[B] 3v4[/B]

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>[B] 3v3[/B]

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> [B]5v[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> [B]0v[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> [B]0v[/B]

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> [B]3v3[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> [B]0v4[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> [B]3v3[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> [B]0v3[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> [B]1v7[/B]

<SIGNAL>PP1V35_S3</SIGNAL> [B]0v[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL> [B]0v[/B][/QUOTE]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - Dead pp5vS4/0
threads.message: I noticed pp5vs4 has a resitance to ground of 18ohm but only when powered, is this normal ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - Dead pp5vS4/0
threads.message: You can't measure resistance to ground when the board is powered on..... Any history liquid damage drop etc?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - Dead pp5vS4/0
threads.message: no liquid damage but i found a bit of green stuff above <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> at <RESISTOR>R7752</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7753</RESISTOR> but that should not stop te macbook from booting

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a - Dead pp5vS4/0
threads.message: There is corrosion so probably there is more. The usual suspects apply, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP>, <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, J6100, <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> area including all the termination resistors to <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, crap under SMC.
